thread.title: Leaky Boot at Sail, Power and Steam
thread.title_full: Leaky Boot at Sail, Power and Steam

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Leaky Boot at Sail, Power and Steam
text:
Leaky Boot at Sail, Power and Steam Oct 15, 2015 Leaky Boot Jug Band 
Rockland — The Sail, Power and Steam Museum at Sharp’s Point South will present a concert by the Leaky Boot Jug Band Saturday, Oct. 24, at 7:30 p.m. 
This group of Waldo County rabble rousers covers acoustic material ranging from traditional blues to the Grateful Dead, with some bluegrass tossed in for good measure. The band includes Neal Parent on harmonica, Travis Lloyd on bass and guitar, Jon Kerr on banjo, Tom Fowler on mandolin, Dan Miller on hand drums, Russ Lloyd on guitar and bass, with James Bryant on the jug. According to Russ Lloyd, everyone contributes vocals “and noises as necessary.” 
Tickets are $12; calling early for best seats is recommended. Sharp’s Point South and the Sail, Power and Steam Museum are at 75 Mechanic St. For more information on the museum and its programs, call 701-7627 or 596-0200; email sailpowersteammuseum@gmail.com; or visit sailpowersteammuseum.org . 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com.
